messages.message:
In converse mode, I seem to have gotten the model into a mode where it is suggesting questions for me to ask about a document, without me prompting it to.  This seems to happen after I respond with a correction absent a follow up question.

This strikes me as the model breaking out of the prompt separation formatting described in the Andrew Ng prompt engineering course, assuming we have some sort of system prompt that distinguishes user input from bot response.
If your query isnt a question, itll ask the question and answer it itself cc: @Rafal
We need some guardrail on this.. Even a basic one to start with!!

In the course, they suggested wrapping the user input with some pattern of characters so the model knows what is what, and doesn't attempt to keep autocompleting the user's input.  For example:
```user_input = input(...)
meta_prompt = f"Try to answer this user's question about the document respectfully and helpfully.  It is designated by 3 single quotes below: \n '''{user_input}'''"```
Then you'd send the meta_prompt to the API.
